summary: The outward appearance of a glamorous and enchanting life can be misleading, as the reality involves significant challenges and pressures.
The life of a royal is heavily burdened by duties and responsibilities, leaving little room for personal freedom and privacy.
Constant public attention and media analysis can lead to a lack of privacy and increased pressure on individuals.
High status can lead to isolation, as it becomes difficult to form genuine relationships due to the fear of exploitation.
The expectation to maintain a perfect and composed image can result in internal struggles with self-doubt and insecurity.
